            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>Lundrigan’s Marsh is a unique 32 hectare cattail marsh, with approximately 23 under a Habitat Stewardship Agreement, situated in an industrial/commercial area of St. John’s NL. Lundrigan’s Marsh is an urban wetland as part of the Virginia River system and habitat for unusual bird sightings. Northeast Avalon ACAP has undertaken data collection to assess wetland function, water and soil quality, and characterization of plant and wildlife. Through the Friends of the Marsh initiative, NAACAP aims to raise awareness of the wetland and restore vegetative buffers with the support of business and community partners.  Project funding is from Department of Environment and Climate Change,  National Wetland Conservation Fund.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-c4d2-e296
notes: Lundrigan’s Marsh is a unique 32 hectare cattail marsh, with approximately 23 under a Habitat Stewardship Agreement, situated in an industrial/commercial area of St. John’s NL. Lundrigan’s Marsh is an urban wetland as part of the Virginia River system and habitat for unusual bird sightings. Northeast Avalon ACAP has undertaken data collection to assess wetland function, water and soil quality, and characterization of plant and wildlife. Through the Friends of the Marsh initiative, NAACAP aims to raise awareness of the wetland and restore vegetative buffers with the support of business and community partners.  Project funding is from Department of Environment and Climate Change,  National Wetland Conservation Fund.

notes_translated.en: Lundrigan’s Marsh is a unique 32 hectare cattail marsh, with approximately 23 under a Habitat Stewardship Agreement, situated in an industrial/commercial area of St. John’s NL. Lundrigan’s Marsh is an urban wetland as part of the Virginia River system and habitat for unusual bird sightings. Northeast Avalon ACAP has undertaken data collection to assess wetland function, water and soil quality, and characterization of plant and wildlife. Through the Friends of the Marsh initiative, NAACAP aims to raise awareness of the wetland and restore vegetative buffers with the support of business and community partners.  Project funding is from Department of Environment and Climate Change,  National Wetland Conservation Fund.
notes_translated.fr: Le marais de Lundrigan est un marais à quenouilles unique de 32 hectares, dont environ 23 en vertu d'un accord d'intendance de l'habitat, situé dans une zone industrielle/commerciale de St. John's, à Terre-Neuve-et-Labrador. Le marais de Lundrigan est une zone humide urbaine faisant partie du réseau de la rivière Virginia et un habitat propice à des observations inhabituelles d'oiseaux. L'ACAP du nord-est d'Avalon a entrepris une collecte de données pour évaluer la fonction des zones humides, la qualité de l'eau et du sol et la caractérisation de la faune et de la flore. Dans le cadre de l'initiative Friends of the Marsh, la NAACAP vise à sensibiliser le public à la zone humide et à restaurer les zones tampons végétatives avec le soutien de partenaires commerciaux et communautaires. Le financement du projet provient du Fonds national de conservation des zones humides du ministère de l'Environnement et du Changement climatique.

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.
